RelatedSentence: A martial arts instructor who sent ricin-laced letters to President Obama and Sen. Roger Wicker ( R - Miss . )

Mississippi resident James Everett Dutschke , 41 , was convicted of possessing the biological agent ricin and subsequently mailing ricin-laced , threatening letters including one that threatened bodily harm to the president of the United States , the Justice Department said in a release .

Mississippi resident James Everett Dutschke , 41 , was convicted of possessing the biological agent ricin and subsequently mailing ricin-laced , threatening letters including one that threatened bodily harm to the president of the United States , the Justice Department said in a release .

Mississippi resident James Everett Dutschke , 41 , was convicted of possessing the biological agent ricin and subsequently mailing ricin-laced , threatening letters including one that threatened bodily harm to the president of the United States , the Justice Department said in a release .
In addition to his 300 - month prison sentence , Dutschke will serve a term of 5 years of supervised release .
As part of his plea agreement , Dutschke waived his right to appeal .
Dutschke sent ricin-laced letters as part of a scheme to frame his rival , Kevin Curtis , a former Elvis impersonator .
Curtis , who was initially charged in the ricin attack , is suing Dutschke for defamation .
According to The Associated Press , Dutschke told the judge in his case that the government had falsified evidence and that Curtis was in fact guilty of the crime .
